message_1: A math student wants to use Caesar Cipher to encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" with a shift value of 5. What would be the result of the encryption?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using a Caesar Cipher with a shift value of 5, we will shift each letter in the message 5 positions forward in the alphabet. If a letter reaches the end of the alphabet, it will wrap around to the beginning.

M -> R
A -> F
T -> Y
H -> M
E -> J
M -> R
A -> F
T -> Y
I -> N
C -> H
S -> X

So, the encrypted message would be "RFYJRFYNHX".
